alert.note: Alert for Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:18PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Aroostook County through 545 PM EDT... At 517 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Allagash, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Kent, Eagle Lake, Allagash, Deboullie Mountain, New Canada, Allagash Township, Wallagrass, Winterville, Saint Francis, Saint John and Soldier Pond. This includes State Highway 11 between Eagle Lake and Wallagrass. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northern Maine.
